question: Reproductive health refers to a total ______ in all aspects of reproduction.
Reproductive health includes physical, ______, behavioural and social aspects.
Our nation was the first nation in the world to initiate various ______ at national level towards attaining a reproductively healthy society.
Counselling and creating ______ among people about reproductive organs is the primary step towards reproductive health.
Counselling involves reproductive organs, adolescence and associated ______.
Safe and hygienic sexual practices help to prevent ______.
Sexually transmitted infections include ______.
Providing medical facilities and care to problems like ______ irregularities is part of RCH programmes.
Medical facilities also include pregnancy related aspects and ______.
Medical termination of ______ is also covered under RCH programmes.
RCH programmes also address ______, birth control, infertility, post natal child and maternal management.
An overall improvement in reproductive health has taken place in our ______.
Reduced maternal and infant ______ rates indicate reproductive health improvement.
Early detection and cure of ______ has improved reproductive health.
Assistance to ______ couples is part of reproductive health improvements.
Improved health facilities and better living conditions promoted an explosive growth of ______.
Such a growth necessitated intense propagation of ______ methods.
Various contraceptive options include natural, traditional, ______, IUDs, pills, injectables, implants and surgical methods.
Though contraceptives are not regular requirements, one is forced to use them to avoid ______.
Medical termination of pregnancy is ______ in our country.
MTP is generally performed to get rid of unwanted pregnancy due to ______.
MTP can also be performed due to ______ relationship.
MTP is done when continuation of pregnancy could be harmful or even ______.
Infections transmitted through sexual intercourse are called ______.
Pelvic ______ Diseases are one of the complications of STIs.
STIs can cause still birth and ______.
Early detection facilitates better ______ of these diseases.
Avoiding sexual intercourse with unknown or ______ partners prevents STIs.
Use of ______ during coitus is a simple precaution against STIs.
Inability to conceive even after 2 years of unprotected sexual cohabitation is called ______.
Various methods are now available to help ______ couples.
In Vitro ______ is one such method to assist infertile couples.
In Vitro fertilisation is followed by transfer of ______ into the female genital tract.
In Vitro fertilisation and embryo transfer is known as the ______ programme.
